result.execSummary:
The defendant Shawn G Rucker was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property fr. Person, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).
  • 2nd-Degree Recklessly Endangering Safety, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.30(2).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: EACH COUNT:  All Court costs, fees and surcharges including DNA surcharge.  To be paid through collection by DOC from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of Extended Supervision.  DOC shall collect those sums.   To be paid by end of supervision.   Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.
Concurrent with: Concurrent with count seven, but consecutive to any other sentence. Credit of 238 days.

superMiscConds.notes:
Follow all rules of supervision. Follow through with any other treatment deemed necessary by the department.
All applicable fees of supervision  by end of supervision.

supervisions.notes:
Provide a DNA sample.
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm; and that he may not vote until his civil rights have been restored.

Concurrent with: Concurrent with count one, but consecutive to any other sentence.  Credit of  238 days.
**April 2, 2015  credit amended to 238 days  on count one and on count seven.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Shawn G Rucker

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Per Order signed on April 2, 2015:  credit amended to reflect a total of 238 days sentence credit on count one and on count seven (rather than 308 days).
Order Amending Sentence Credit signed and filed.  Copies to the District Attorney's Office and Attorney Michael Holzman.
Per Order of the Presiding Judge, Felony Division, this motion/request is hereby assigned to the Hon. Timothy M. Witkowiak, Br. 22, for review.  jbs
Letter from Attorney Michael Holzman revising sentence credit calculation.

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  

As to Count 1:
The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of  2 YEARS with 308 days credit CONCURRENT to Count 7 but CONSECUTIVE to any other sentence; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 1 YEAR; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 1 YEAR.

As to Count 7:
The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of  6.5 YEARS with 308 days credit CONCURRENT to Count 1 but CONSECUTIVE to any other sentence; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 2.5 YEARS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 4 YEARS.

Court finds defendant IS NOT eligible for the Challenge Incarceration program or the WI Substance Abuse program.  

Conditions of Extended Supervision:
- No possession/consumption/selling/distribution of illegal drugs/alcohol.
- Obtain/maintain fulltime employment/education/vocation.
- Provide a DNA sample.
- Follow all rules of supervision and follow through with any other treatment deemed necessary by the department.

Court ordered the defendant pay all of the following by the end of supervision.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment: 
Restitution set at zero; 
All court costs, fees, and surcharges (including DNA); 
All applicable fees of supervision.
-  No Cash Bail Posted in this matter 
-  Court ordered that all court costs, fines, surcharges and/or restitution be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision. DOC shall collect those sums.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.

Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm. 
Court advised defendant of his right to seek postconviction relief.
Court advised defendant that he may not vote until his civil rights have been restored.  

Filed:  
Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence 
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
Ineligible Voting Notice & Acknowledgement
Pre-trial Incarceration Credit

Court ordered defendant REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.

Defendant Shawn G Rucker in court with attorney Michael S. Holzman.  Defendant Shawn G Rucker in custody.  Patrick J Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Pursuant to plea negotiations, Counts 2-6 are dismissed but read in for the purpose of sentencing.  As to Counts 1 & 7:
Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.  
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm.  Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.

Attorney Michael S. Holzman in court, defendant Shawn G Rucker not in court, in custody.  Patrick J Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for scheduling conference.  Defense requests plea and sentencing date.  Case remains calendared in Branch 22.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for March 18, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Michael S. Holzman in court, defendant Shawn G Rucker not in court, in custody.  Patrick J Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for scheduling conference.  Defense requests more time.  Case remains calendared in Branch 22.  Scheduling conference scheduled for February 2, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Shawn G Rucker in court with attorney Michael S. Holzman.  Defendant Shawn G Rucker in custody.  Michael Jerome Lonski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Witkowiak, Branch 22.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pleads not guilty.  Scheduling conference scheduled for January 21, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.
  Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

ADDRESS INFO for Shawn G Rucker
Current: 5141 N 51ST ST, Milwaukee, WI 53218 United States  (Effective: 12-14-2014)
Prior: 7341 N. Damen Avenue, Chicago, IL 60645

Defendant Shawn G Rucker in court with attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent.  Defendant Shawn G Rucker in custody.  Abbey Marie DeSiato appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge WITKOWIAK, Branch 22.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.

  Preliminary hearing scheduled for December 22, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
Arrest Warrant received from the D.A.'s office on filing date of Criminal Complaint.
